make_STAR_index.string_process:
process make_STAR_index{
        label 'multithreaded'
        publishDir path: { params.save_ref ? "${params.outdir}/reference_genome" : params.outdir },
                   saveAs: { params.save_ref ? it : null }, mode: 'copy'

        input:
        file fasta from idx_fasta
        file gtf from idx_gtf

        output:
        file "star" into star_index

        script:
        """
        mkdir star
        STAR \\
            --runMode genomeGenerate \\
            --runThreadN ${task.cpus} \\
            --sjdbGTFfile $gtf \\
            --genomeDir star/ \\
            --genomeFastaFiles $fasta
        """
    }
directive: publishDir path: { params.save_ref ? "${params.outdir}/reference_genome" : params.outdir } , saveAs: { params.save_ref ? it : null }, mode: 'copy'

fastqc.string_process:
process fastqc{
    publishDir "${params.outdir}/fastqc", mode: 'copy'

    input:
    set val(name), file(r) from raw_fastqc

    output:
    file "*_fastqc.{zip,html}" into fastqc_results

    script:
    """
    fastqc -q $r
    """
}

tools_dico.name: FastQC
tools_dico.description: This tool aims to provide a QC report which can spot problems or biases which originate either in the sequencer or in the starting library material. It can be run in one of two modes. It can either run as a stand alone interactive application for the immediate analysis of small numbers of FastQ files, or it can be run in a non-interactive mode where it would be suitable for integrating into a larger analysis pipeline for the systematic processing of large numbers of files.

trim.string_process:
process trim{
    publishDir "${params.outdir}/trim_galore", mode: 'copy'

    input:
    set val(name), file(r) from raw_trimgalore

    output:
    file "*fq.gz" into trimmed_reads
    file "*trimming_report.txt" into trimgalore_results
    file "*_fastqc.{zip,html}" into trimgalore_fastqc_reports


    script:
    
    c_r1 = clip_r1 > 0 ? "--clip_r1 ${clip_r1}" : ''
    c_r2 = clip_r2 > 0 ? "--clip_r2 ${clip_r2}" : ''
    tpc_r1 = three_prime_clip_r1 > 0 ? "--three_prime_clip_r1 ${three_prime_clip_r1}" : ''
    tpc_r2 = three_prime_clip_r2 > 0 ? "--three_prime_clip_r2 ${three_prime_clip_r2}" : ''
    
    if (params.pair == "single") {
        """
        trim_galore --fastqc --gzip $c_r1 $tpc_r1 $r
        """
    } else {
        """
        trim_galore --paired --fastqc --gzip $c_r1 $c_r2 $tpc_r1 $tpc_r2 $r
        """
    }
}

star.string_process:
process star{
    label 'multithreaded'
    publishDir "${params.outdir}/STAR", mode: 'copy'

    input:
    each file(reads) from trimmed_reads
    file index from star_index
    file gtf from gen_gtf

    output:
    set file("*Log.final.out"), file ('*.bam') into star_aligned
    file "*.out" into alignment_logs
    file "*SJ.out.tab"
    file "*Log.out" into star_log
    file "${prefix}Aligned.sortedByCoord.out.bam.bai" into bam_index_rseqc, bam_index_genebody
    file "*ReadsPerGene.out.tab" into raw_counts
    file "*sortedByCoord.out.bam" into bams

    script:
    prefix = reads[0].toString() - ~/(_R1)?(_trimmed)?(_val_1)?(\.fq)?(\.fastq)?(\.gz)?$/

    """
    STAR --genomeDir $index \\
         --sjdbGTFfile $gtf \\
         --readFilesIn $reads  \\
         --runThreadN ${task.cpus} \\
         --twopassMode Basic \\
         --outWigType bedGraph \\
         --outSAMtype BAM SortedByCoordinate \\
         --readFilesCommand zcat \\
         --runDirPerm All_RWX \\
         --outFileNamePrefix $prefix \\
         --quantMode GeneCounts \\
         --outSAMattributes All
        
    samtools index ${prefix}Aligned.sortedByCoord.out.bam
    """
}
star.string_script:
prefix = reads[0].toString() - ~/(_R1)?(_trimmed)?(_val_1)?(\.fq)?(\.fastq)?(\.gz)?$/

    """
    STAR --genomeDir $index \\
         --sjdbGTFfile $gtf \\
         --readFilesIn $reads  \\
         --runThreadN ${task.cpus} \\
         --twopassMode Basic \\
         --outWigType bedGraph \\
         --outSAMtype BAM SortedByCoordinate \\
         --readFilesCommand zcat \\
         --runDirPerm All_RWX \\
         --outFileNamePrefix $prefix \\
         --quantMode GeneCounts \\
         --outSAMattributes All
        
    samtools index ${prefix}Aligned.sortedByCoord.out.bam
    """

tools_dico.name: SAMtools
tools_dico.description: A software package with various utilities for processing alignments in the SAM format, including variant calling and alignment viewing.

mixcr.string_process:
process mixcr{
    publishDir "${params.outdir}/mixcr", mode: 'copy'
    
    label 'multithreaded'

    input:
    each file(reads) from trimmed_reads

    output:
    file "${prefix}_analysis*txt" into mixcr_out

    script:
    prefix = reads[0].toString() - ~/(_R1)?(_trimmed)?(_val_1)?(\.fq)?(\.fastq)?(\.gz)?$/

    """
    mixcr analyze shotgun --species musmusculus --starting-material rna \
    --only-productive $reads ${prefix}_analysis 
    """
}
mixcr.string_script:
prefix = reads[0].toString() - ~/(_R1)?(_trimmed)?(_val_1)?(\.fq)?(\.fastq)?(\.gz)?$/

    """
    mixcr analyze shotgun --species musmusculus --starting-material rna \
    --only-productive $reads ${prefix}_analysis 
    """

tools_dico.name: MiXCR
tools_dico.description: Software for extraction of T- and B-cell receptor repertoires from any type of sequencing data.

tools_dico.name: oPOSSUM

topic.term: Nucleic acid sites, features and motifs

tools_dico.description: oPOSSUM is a web-based system for the detection of over-represented transcription factor binding sites in the promoters of sets of genes.

platypus.string_process:
process platypus{
    label 'multithreaded'
    publishDir "${params.outdir}/platypus", mode: 'copy'

    input:
    each file(bamfile) from platypus_in
    file reference from raw_fasta

    output:
    file "${bamfile.baseName}.vcf.gz" into platypus_vcf
    file "${bamfile.baseName}.vcf.gz.csi" into platypus_index

    script:
    """
    samtools faidx $reference
    samtools index $bamfile

    platypus callVariants --bamFiles $bamfile --refFile $reference --filterDuplicates 0 --minMapQual 0 \
	--minFlank 0 --maxReadLength 500 --minGoodQualBases 10 --minBaseQual 20 -o ${bamfile.baseName}.vcf \
    --nCPU ${task.cpus}

    bgzip ${bamfile.baseName}.vcf
    bcftools index ${bamfile.baseName}.vcf.gz
    """
}
platypus.string_script:
"""
    samtools faidx $reference
    samtools index $bamfile

    platypus callVariants --bamFiles $bamfile --refFile $reference --filterDuplicates 0 --minMapQual 0 \
	--minFlank 0 --maxReadLength 500 --minGoodQualBases 10 --minBaseQual 20 -o ${bamfile.baseName}.vcf \
    --nCPU ${task.cpus}

    bgzip ${bamfile.baseName}.vcf
    bcftools index ${bamfile.baseName}.vcf.gz
    """

tools_dico.name: SAMtools
tools_dico.description: A software package with various utilities for processing alignments in the SAM format, including variant calling and alignment viewing.

tools_dico.name: platypus
tools_dico.description: A tool designed for efficient and accurate variant-detection in high-throughput sequencing data using local realignment of reads and local assembly. Platypus can detect SNPs, MNPs, short indels, replacements and (using the assembly option) deletions up to several kb.

tools_dico.name: BCFtools
tools_dico.description: Set of utilities that manipulate variant calls in the Variant Call Format (VCF) and its binary counterpart BCF. All commands work transparently with both VCFs and BCFs, both uncompressed and BGZF-compressed.

common_variants.string_process:
process common_variants {
    publishDir "${params.outdir}/variants", mode: 'copy'

    input:
    file(vcfs) from platypus_vcf.collect()
    file(indexes) from platypus_index.collect()

    output:
    file "overlapping_variants.vcf" into present_variants

    script:
    """
    bcftools isec $vcfs -n =${vcfs.size()} -O v -o overlapping_variants.vcf
    """
}

tools_dico.name: BCFtools
tools_dico.description: Set of utilities that manipulate variant calls in the Variant Call Format (VCF) and its binary counterpart BCF. All commands work transparently with both VCFs and BCFs, both uncompressed and BGZF-compressed.

snpEff.string_process:
process snpEff {
    publishDir "${params.outdir}/snpEff", mode: 'copy'
    label 'multithreaded'

    input:
    file var from present_variants

    output:
    file "effects.vcf" into snp_effects

    script:
    """
    snpEff ann GRCh38.86 $var -Xmx4096m > effects.vcf
    """
}

tools_dico.name: snpEff

topic.term: Nucleic acid sites, features and motifs

tools_dico.description: Variant annotation and effect prediction tool. It annotates and predicts the effects of variants on genes and proteins (such as amino acid changes).

create_alt.string_process:
process create_alt{
    publishDir "${params.outdir}/alt_genome", mode: 'copy'

    input:
    file snps from snp_effects
    file genome from alt_fasta

    output:
    file "alt.fasta" into alt_genome

    script:
    """
    gatk FastaAlternateReferenceMaker --reference $alt_fasta --variant $snps --output alt.fasta
    """
}

tools_dico.name: GATK
tools_dico.description:
The Genome Analysis Toolkit (GATK) is a set of bioinformatic tools for analyzing high-throughput sequencing (HTS) and variant call format (VCF) data. The toolkit is well established for germline short variant discovery from whole genome and exome sequencing data. GATK4 expands functionality into copy number and somatic analyses and offers pipeline scripts for workflows.  

Version 4 (GATK4) is open-source at https://github.com/broadinstitute/gatk.

gene_fasta.string_process:
process gene_fasta{
    publishDir "${params.outdir}/gene_fasta", mode: 'copy'

    input:
    file alt from alt_genome
    file gtf from trans_gtf

    output:
    file "genes.fasta" into gene_fasta

    script:
    """
    #see if we need split or not...
    bedtools getfasta -name -s -fi $alt -bed $gtf -fo genes.fasta"
    """
}
gene_fasta.string_script:
"""
    #see if we need split or not...
    bedtools getfasta -name -s -fi $alt -bed $gtf -fo genes.fasta"
    """

tools_dico.name: BEDTools
tools_dico.description: BEDTools is an extensive suite of utilities for comparing genomic features in BED format.
